Class ec.plubar.UnumIngredientEntry 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----ec.plubar.UnumIngredientEntry
public class UnumIngredientEntry
extends Object
For use in the UnumDefinition's table of ingredients; includes a flag indicating if this ingredient's state should be encoded upon Unum encoding.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Karl Schumaker

encodeState
A flag indicating if this Ingredients state bundle is to be encoded or not
index
The index of this Ingredient as it is added to the UnumDefinition; used to look up an Ingredient in the Unum.myIngredients[] array.

UnumIngredientEntry(int, boolean)
The constructor for UnumIngredientEntry

decode(RtDecoder)
Decode this definition, decoding an int and a boolean.
encode(RtEncoder)
Encode this entry, writing int index and boolean encodeState.

index 
 int index
The index of this Ingredient as it is added to the UnumDefinition; used to look up an Ingredient in the Unum.myIngredients[] array.

encodeState 
 boolean encodeState
A flag indicating if this Ingredients state bundle is to be encoded or not

UnumIngredientEntry 
 public UnumIngredientEntry(int number,
                            boolean encode)
The constructor for UnumIngredientEntry

Parameters:
number - The number of an ingredient
encode - Whether or not to encode this ingredient's state when sending an Unum across the wire

encode 
 public void encode(RtEncoder encoder) throws UnumException
Encode this entry, writing int index and boolean encodeState.

Parameters:
encoder - The encoder to encode into
Throws: UnumException
when an IOException encoding error occurs in encoder.writeInt() or encode.writeBoolean().
decode 
 public void decode(RtDecoder decoder) throws UnumException
Decode this definition, decoding an int and a boolean.

Parameters:
decoder - The decoder to decode from
Throws: UnumException
when an IOException decoding error occurs in decoder.readInt() or decoder.readBoolean()
